spanishExample: ¡Ven! Tienes cada vez menos tiempo para darme ese libro.
englishTranslation: Come! You have less and less time to give me that book.
vocabIncluded: para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: ¡Venga! Pero solo si tiene algo de tiempo…
englishTranslation: (formal) Come! But only if you have some time….

spanishExample: ¿Qué tal? ¿Quieres que nos veamos mañana?
englishTranslation: What’s up? Do you want us to see each other tomorrow?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
veamos: see, we see (Ver, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Tienes alguno? No vemos nada, pero queremos que tú veas eso.
englishTranslation: Do you have any (singular)? We don’t see anything, but we want you to see that.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
veas: see, you see (Ver, subjunctive, 2nd person)
vemos: see, we see (Ver, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Ves lo que digo? Él no quiere que yo venga.
englishTranslation: Do you see what I’m saying? He doesn't want me to come.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
venga: come, I come (Venir, subjunctive, 1st person)
ves: see, you see (Ver, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: A ver… ¿sabes si hay suficiente comida para que él venga?
englishTranslation: Let’s see… Do you know if there’s enough food for him to come?
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
venga: come, he/she/it come (Venir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Algún hombre lo tiene, pero aquí hay bastantes.
englishTranslation: Some man has it, but here there are quite a few.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Ciertos hombres irán con algunas de esas cosas.
englishTranslation: Certain men will go with some of those things.

spanishExample: Dices eso porque has visto demasiados autos.
englishTranslation: You say that because you have seen too many cars.
vocabIncluded: has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Estábamos viendo eso cuando él nos vio.
englishTranslation: We were seeing that when he saw us.
vocabIncluded: vio: saw, he/she/it saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hacen esas cosas para que vengamos aquí cada vez más.
englishTranslation: They do those things so that we come here more and more.

spanishExample: Hay poca luz en este lugar, queremos que vengan con todo el equipo.
englishTranslation: There’s little light in this place, we want them to come with all the equipment.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Mi amiga lo ve cada vez más.
englishTranslation: My friend(f) sees him more and more.
vocabIncluded: ve: sees, he/she/it sees (Ver, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No estabas en la fiesta y como tal, vinimos a verte.
englishTranslation: You weren’t at the party and as such, we came to see you.

spanishExample: No nos decimos tales cosas.
englishTranslation: We don’t tell each other such things.

spanishExample: No se vieron porque él no vino.
englishTranslation: They didn’t see each other because he didn’t come.
vocabIncluded: vieron: saw, they saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No tienes ninguno y por tal razón no quiero que vengas.
englishTranslation: You have none and for such a reason I don’t want you to come.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
por tal razón: "for such a reason" (idiom)

spanishExample: No tienes que venir con tantas cosas, tal vez una sea suficiente.
englishTranslation: You don’t have to come with so many things, maybe one is enough.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: No vimos nada y no sabemos si ellos vienen.
englishTranslation: We didn’t see anything and we don’t know if they are coming.
vocabIncluded: vimos: saw, we saw (Ver, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No vine ayer porque no tuve tiempo.
englishTranslation: I didn’t come yesterday because I didn’t have time.

spanishExample: Nos decimos la verdad, pero no le dije que él vino.
englishTranslation: We tell each other the truth, but I didn’t tell her that he came.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Puedes estar en cualquier mesa si vienes con ella.
englishTranslation: You can be at any table if you come with her.

spanishExample: Queremos que ellos vean que él sí ha venido aquí.
englishTranslation: We want them to see that he HAS come here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
sí: adverb meaning "indeed" or otherwise providing positive emphasis
vean: see, they see (Ver, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quieren que vengas cada vez menos.
englishTranslation: They want you to come less and less.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero que vea lo que hago por él.
englishTranslation: I want him to see what I do for him.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
vea: see, he/she/it see (Ver, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Saben que él viene porque lo vieron.
englishTranslation: They know he’s coming because they saw him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
vieron: saw, they saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Se van a ver con algunos amigos.
englishTranslation: They are going to see each other with some friends.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Siempre venimos a cada uno de estos lugares.
englishTranslation: We always come to each one of these places.

spanishExample: Tiene muchos dólares y por eso vinieron a verlo.
englishTranslation: He has a lot of dollars and that’s why they came to see him.

spanishExample: Vas a ver lo que ellos siempre ven.
englishTranslation: You are going to see what they always see.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
ven: see, they see (Ver, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Vengamos a este lugar otra vez porque el agua es muy buena.
englishTranslation: Let’s come to this place again because the water is very good.

spanishExample: Vengo contigo porque no viste a ninguna persona.
englishTranslation: I come with you because you didn't see any person.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
vengo: come, I come (Venir, present, 1st person) NEEDS WORK
viste: saw, you saw (Ver, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Veo que no tienes comida aquí.
englishTranslation: I see that you don’t have food here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
veo: see, I see (Ver, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Vi que ellos no estaban en la fiesta.
englishTranslation: I saw they weren’t at the party.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
vi: saw, I saw (Ver, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Viniste a la fiesta para que yo te pueda ver con él.
englishTranslation: You came to the party so that I can see you with him.
vocabIncluded: pueda: "be able", "I be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
